metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3981 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: A flaw in grub2 was found where its configuration file, known as grub.cfg, is being created with the wrong permission set allowing non privileged users to read its content. This represents a low severity confidentiality issue, as those users can eventually read any encrypted passwords present in grub.cfg. This flaw affects grub2 2.06 and previous versions. This issue has been fixed in grub upstream but no version with the fix is currently released.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Introduced by: https://git.savannah.gnu.org/gitweb/?p=grub.git;a=commit;h=ab2e53c8a196a595e50f1c836bf756b9db1ae68d eslerm> patch applied in grub-2.12-rc1

criterions.comment: grub2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
grub2-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
grub2-unsigned: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
